Lapas. The dog is stuck in the middle of the
fierce water and is struggling to know
which direction is safe. Luckily,
Super Wing workers nearby have taken advantage of the floodwaters.  Using a forklift
to approach the dog and take it to a safe place,
these workers are constructing a bridge
along the river bank where
people live. Over the past week,

on October 19, Singapore.  announced that
starting from
2026, this country will require flights
departing from Singapore to use a portion of
sustainable aviation fuel called
saf. This move is in an
important step of the world aviation industry
to  achieve the target of net zero carbon emissions
by 2050. However,
Singapore's move may face some
obstacles as the Singapore authorities announced that
they will initially require flights to
use 1 phase of saf fuel and  gradually increase from the
following years depending on the supply and
level of conversion. SAF is a
replacement fuel for fossil fuels that is
synthesized from hydrogen or from
biological materials such as used cooking oil
or  But it can
cost up to five times more than traditional fuel.
While production currently accounts for only
0.2 percent of the aircraft fuel market,
Singapore will impose a tax
on this new fuel to cover costs.  Paying
for the transition will
mean airfares departing from Singapore
will increase from 2026. There are also
concerns that the composition of
saf fuel is not entirely
stable materials. For example, oil  Coconut
or Palm Oil The EU does not consider Palm Oil a
sustainable fuel because of deforestation activities
to plant palm trees in the
world's leading Palm Oil producing countries located in Southeast
Asia.
